name: badly
content:
badly adverb
(UNPLEASANTLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 in a severe and harmful way: She was badly affected by the events in her childhood. Fortunately, none of the passengers was badly hurt/injured in the crash. I thought he was treated very badly.
More examplesFewer examplesThe way he was shouting, you'd have thought he was badly hurt.Both buildings were badly damaged by the fire.The bush looked badly diseased, with black marks on all the leaves.I think he feels a lot of anger towards his father who treated him very badly as a child.It's hard to believe that he could treat his own family so badly.

badly adverb
(IN A BAD WAY)
A2 in a way that is not acceptable or of good quality: The event was really badly organized. I thought he behaved very badly. Their children are extremely badly behaved.
More examplesFewer examplesHe's always badly dressed.The pot had been badly glazed.The talk she gave was incoherent and badly prepared.The team has performed very badly this season.The whole report is badly written.
